headline.main: QUARANTINE AFFAIRS.; Seizure of Emigrant Baggage--Captain Judkins, of the Persia, under Arrest--The Susquehanna:

docs.lead_paragraph: The disease which is now attracting most attention at Quarantine is the small-pox, several vessels having arrived lately with cases on board. The ship Universe, arrived on the 8th inst. with 300 passengers, and several being sick with the disease, it became necessary to have all the emigrants and their baggage landed, for the purpose of cleansing the ship.
docs.abstract: Arrest of Capt Judkins of the Persia

headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS.......First Session.; SENATE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The private Calendar was taken up, and several unimportant bills passed. A resolution was submitted that the President be requested, as far as compatible with the public interest, to communicate to the Senate any information which may have been received concerning the recent search or seizure of American vessels by foreign armed cruisers in the Gulf of Mexico or adjacent seas; and also, what measures, if any, have been taken in relation thereto. Adopted unanimously.

docs.lead_paragraph: SECOND DAY. Mozart Hall was half filled with men and women at twenty minutes past 10 Wednesday morning, when Mr. GARRISON said : "The Society will please come to order." As the day advanced, however, people flocked in, and the room was soon quite full. A letter from Mr. A. D. MAYO, apologizing for his absence, was read.
